meanings.sent1: After the treatment, she became hyposensitized to pollen and could enjoy the outdoors without sneezing.
meanings.sent2: The doctor hyposensitized the patient to the loud noises by exposing them to gradually increasing volumes.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's special suit hyposensitized him to pain, making him invincible in battles.
meanings.sent4: The meditation practice hyposensitized her mind to distractions, allowing her to focus better.
meanings.sent5: The magical potion hyposensitized the princess to the spells of the evil sorcerer.

meanings.definition: Treat (a person or animal) with a series of gradually increasing doses of an allergen to reduce sensitivity.
meanings.sent1: The veterinarian hyposensitized the dog to the bee venom to prevent severe reactions.
meanings.sent2: They decided to hyposensitize their son to peanuts after discovering his allergy.
meanings.sent3: The circus performer jokingly claimed he needed to be hyposensitized to applause to avoid getting a big head.
meanings.sent4: The coach hyposensitized the team to pressure by simulating high-stress situations in practice.
meanings.sent5: The scientist hyposensitized the lab mice to the toxin to study its effects on their bodies.
